intro: Omphalocarpum mortehanii, commonly known as the narrow-leaf burrweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant produces distinctive burrs that aid in seed dispersal, and it often grows in dry, sandy soils. It is a perennial herb that is typically found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
